contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement <!-- See Template:Infobox settlement for additional fields and descriptions --> | name = Namur | native_name = ({{lang-fr|Namur}}) | native_name_lang = <!-- ISO 639-2 code e.g. "fr" for French. If more than one, use {{lang}} instead --> | settlement_type = [[Provinces of Belgium|Province]] of [[Belgium]] | image_flag = Flag province namur.svg | flag_size = | image_shield = Wapen van Namen (provincie).svg | shield_size = 60px | image_map = Province de Namur in Belgium.svg | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{BEL}} | subdivision_type1 = Region | subdivision_name1 = {{BE-WAL}} | seat_type = Capital | seat = [[Namur (city)]] | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = [[Denis Mathen]] | area_total_km2 = 3,664 | population_footnotes = <ref name="r-pop">{{Metadata Population BE||QUELLE}}</ref> | population_total = {{Metadata Population BE|90000}} | population_as_of = {{Metadata Population BE||STAND}} | population_density_km2 = auto | website = {{URL|http://www.province.namur.be/|Official site}} }} <!--{| align=right |[[Image:Namur Flag.png|right|100px]] |- |[[Image:BelgiumNamur.png|right|200px|]] |}--> '''Namur''' ([[Dutch language|Dutch]]: {{Audio|Nl-Namen.ogg|''Namen''}}, {{lang-wa|Nameur}}) is a [[Provinces of regions in Belgium|province]] of [[Wallonia]], one of the three regions of [[Belgium]]. It borders (clockwise from the West) on the [[Wallonia|Walloon]] provinces of [[Hainaut (province)|Hainaut]], [[Walloon Brabant]], [[Liège (province)|Liège]] and [[Luxembourg (province of Belgium)|Luxembourg]] in [[Belgium]], and on [[France]]. Its capital is the city of [[Namur (city)|Namur]]. It has an area of 3,664 km² and is divided into three administrative districts (''arrondissements'' in [[French language|French]]) containing 38 local authorities (''communes'' in [[French language|French]]). ==List of Governors== * 1830 - 1834: [[Goswin de Stassart]] (Liberal) * 1834 - 1840: [[Joseph Lebeau]] (Liberal) * 1840 - 1847: Edouard d'Huart (Liberal) * 1887 - 1848: Adolphe de Vrière (Liberal) * 1848 - 1851: François Pirson (Liberal) * 1853 - 1875: Charles de Baillet ([[Catholic Party (Belgium)|Catholic Party]]) * 1876 - 1877: D. de Mevius * 1877 - 1881: Albert de Beauffort ([[Catholic Party (Belgium)|Catholic Party]]) * 1881 - 1882: Léon Pety de Thozée (Liberal) * 1882 - 1884: Auguste Vergote * 1884 - 1914: Charles de Montpellier de Vedrin * 1919 - 1937: Pierre de Gaiffier d'Hestroy * 1937 - 1944: François Bovesse (Liberal) * 1945 - 1968: Robert Gruslin * 1968 - 1977: René Close ([[Socialist Party (francophone Belgium)|PS]]) * 1977 - 1980: Pierre Falize ([[Socialist Party (francophone Belgium)|PS]]) * 1980 - 1987: Emile Lacroix * 1987 - 1994: Emile Wauthy ([[Humanist Democratic Centre|PSC]]) * 1994 - 2007: Amand Dalem ([[Humanist Democratic Centre|PSC]]) * 2007–present: Denis Mathen ([[Reformist Movement|MR]]) == Municipalities == With the numbers related to the image. [[File:NamenGemeenten.png|thumb|250px|right|Municipal divisions of Namur (click on image for full legend).]] === Arrondissement of Dinant === * [[Anhée]] * [[Beauraing]] * [[Bièvre]] * [[Ciney]] * [[Dinant]] * [[Gedinne]] * [[Hamois]] * [[Hastière]] * [[Havelange]] * [[Houyet]] * [[Onhaye]] * [[Rochefort, Belgium|Rochefort]] * [[Somme-Leuze]] * [[Vresse-sur-Semois]] * [[Yvoir]] === Arrondissement of Namur === * [[Andenne]] * [[Assesse]] * [[Eghezée]] * [[Fernelmont]] * [[Floreffe]] - 13 * [[Fosses-la-Ville]] - 15 * [[Gembloux]] * [[Gesves]] * [[Jemeppe-sur-Sambre]] - 23 * [[La Bruyère, Belgium|La Bruyère]] * [[Mettet]] * [[Namur (city)|Namur]] * [[Ohey]] * [[Profondeville]] * [[Sambreville]] - 32 * [[Sombreffe]] - 33 === Arrondissement of Philippeville === * [[Cerfontaine, Belgium|Cerfontaine]] * [[Couvin]] * [[Doische]] * [[Florennes]] * [[Philippeville]] * [[Viroinval]] * [[Walcourt]] ==See also== *[[Marquis of Namur|List of rulers of Namur]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Namur (Province of Belgium)}} *[http://www.province.namur.be/ Province de Namur's official website] {{Subdivisions of Belgium}} {{coord|50|28|N|4|51|E|display=title|region:BE-WNA_type:adm2nd_source:GNS-enwiki}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Namur}} [[Category:Namur (province)| ]] [[Category:NUTS 2 statistical regions of the European Union]] [[Category:Walloon provinces]]
